metadata.name: Whoami.EXE Execution Anomaly
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with suspicious parent processes.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\whoami.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('whoami.exe') AND NOT (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\cmd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\powershell_ise.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\pwsh.exe')) OR process.parent_process.name is null OR lower(process.parent_process.name) = lower('')) AND NOT endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower(':\\\\program files\\\\microsoft monitoring agent\\\\agent\\\\monitoringhost.exe')))

output.summary: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with suspicious parent processes.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Admin activity 2. Scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment 3. Monitoring activity References: https://brica.de/alerts/alert/public/1247926/agent-tesla-keylogger-delivered-inside-a-power-iso-daa-archive/, https://app.any.run/tasks/7eaba74e-c1ea-400f-9c17-5e30eee89906/, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DsJ9ByX84o4&t=6s
